Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2016 07:58AM Sherri_T wrote: Hi all just stopping in to see how everyone is doing. Hope I can relate to that thick feeling and no amount of water clears it up. Dara thanks for the baking soda rinse tip. I survived the first infusion and felt good until a couple hours after words then felt 'off' Had terrible acid reflux and didn't get much sleep so hope I can nap today. They had some trouble accessing my veins for the infusion so I am going to have a PICC line installed. I asked about a port but my MO didn't feel it is necessary. Oh I will be doing AC-T. Enjoy your day ladies
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo August 2016? MFalabella Kechla

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2016 05:13PM Sherri_T wrote: Hello all! I too am joining this exclusive club with my first infusion on Friday the 19th. I'm a 51 yr old (ugg!) single mom with a son at home and daughter away at school, but nearby. Trying to keep a positive attitude and find the upside in situations if I can. Glad to 'meet' you all and look forward to having people to go through this journey with that truly understand! Still working on my signature
